forecast.rationale: The status quo strongly favors Cuomo winning since he currently leads in polls. However, the headline indicates his lead is narrowing with Mamdani gaining ground, which introduces meaningful uncertainty. Key factors: (1) We are only 15 days from the primary - enough time for shifts but limited runway for dramatic reversals. (2) Cuomo has very high name recognition as former governor, which typically advantages candidates in primaries. (3) He carries significant political baggage from his resignation amid scandals, which could mobilize opposition turnout. (4) The narrowing trend suggests negative momentum, but we lack specific polling numbers to quantify how close the race actually is. (5) Primary outcomes are harder to predict than general elections due to lower turnout and more volatile voter composition. Good forecasting principles suggest weighting the status quo heavily - Cuomo is ahead, and frontrunners usually win. However, the narrowing margin prevents this from being a high-confidence forecast. I would need to see actual poll numbers showing either a comfortable Cuomo lead (to go higher) or a statistical tie/Mamdani lead (to go lower).
